title: Kinder Morgan Co-Founder Richard Kinder Bought Up Millions in Stock
text:
Text size

Richard Kinder hasn’t lacked enthusiasm for the energy-pipelines company he co-founded and serves as executive chairman, judging by his stock purchases this year.

Kinder has paid $128.5 million so far this year for Kinder Morgan stock (ticker: KMI) on the open market. His latest purchases were on Aug. 23 and 26, when he paid a total of $13.9 million for 700,000 Kinder Morgan shares, an average price of $19.87 each. Kinder now owns 241.9 million Kinder Morgan shares in a personal account and owns another 11.8 million shares through a limited partnership, according to a form he filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. He is the largest Kinder Morgan shareholder, with a stake of more than 11% of shares outstanding.

Both Richard Kinder and Kinder Morgan declined to comment on the latest stock purchases.

Editor's Choice

Kinder Morgan stock has surged 31.8% in 2019 through Friday’s close at $20.27, nearly double the 16.7% gain in the S&P 500 index. But the shares are off 6.7% from a 52-week intraday high of $21.495 set on June 24.

Kinder Morgan stock got a lift after a recent sale of some assets to a Canadian firm.

Inside Scoop is a regular Barron’s feature covering stock transactions by corporate executives and board members—so-called insiders—as well as large shareholders, politicians, and other prominent figures. Due to their insider status, these investors are required to disclose stock trades with the Securities and Exchange Commission or other regulatory groups.
